intro: Salsola nigrescens, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant in the Amaranthaceae family. It is a short-lived perennial that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has spiny leaves and produces small, greenish flowers that develop into bristly, wind-dispersed seeds. It is well adapted to harsh conditions, with deep roots and a high tolerance for drought. Salsola nigrescens is often considered a weed but plays a role in stabilizing soil in disturbed areas.
